p: The statistical analysis of total phenols content (TPC) of the seed extract of L. iberica showed the highest phenol content was 23.02 mg gallic acid (GAE) per g dry matter (DM) related to the interaction of NPK-n + Fe-chelated-n and winter sowing and the lowest was 10.43 mg GAE g −1 DM related to the interaction of the control and spring sowing ( Figure 4A). With respect to the TPC of leaf extract, the highest (13.26 mg GAE g −1 DM) was measured in the winter-sown plants treated within corporated NPK-s + NPK-n + Fe-chelated-n and the lowest (3.85 mg GAE g −1 DM) in the spring-sown plants that were not treated with any fertilizers ( Figure 4B).
